steps.title: Launch site
details: User opens a browser and navigates to https://invoify.vercel.app/en (10.8 s).

steps.title: Landing / redirect
details: Page loads and auto-redirects to dashboard; user confirms presence of “Actions” heading (9.2 s).

steps.title: Header check
details: User scans header and sees the Invoify logo (9.9 s).

steps.title: Screenshot for record
details: User captures screenshot of dashboard with logo (2.5 s).

emotional_arc: Initial curiosity → brief wait while page loads (slight impatience) → relief when dashboard appears → quick confirmation of branding (confidence) → neutral close.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Slow first paint risks bounce; impatience grows quickly on first visit.
next_actions: Add lightweight skeleton loader to reassure users.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users landing on “/en” may not expect an immediate dashboard; lack of context can feel disorienting.
next_actions: Show brief loading/intro message explaining redirect reason.
Ensure URL updates cleanly to /dashboard to set expectation.
Add breadcrumb or page title that reinforces location.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Header logo doubles as important navigation and brand signal; accessibility issues erode trust.
next_actions: Make logo a clickable link back to dashboard/home.
Verify sufficient contrast and responsive sizing for mobile.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Beyond this test, users perform tasks that need confirmation; consistent feedback builds confidence.
next_actions: Use progress indicators on longer operations.

first_tackles.description: Compress and lazy-load hero assets to cut initial load time by 2-3 s.
Add alt text and make header logo a home link for better accessibility/navigation.
Display a short skeleton loader or loading message during redirect to orient users.
Rename dashboard route (/dashboard) or show breadcrumb to clarify current page immediately.
